TITLE.P: SBC 0218 Building Compliance Servicing and Maintenance

SHORT_DESCR.P: Repair and maintenance services of building installations. Stevenage Borough Council is leading on the “ComplyFirst” framework contract seeking a single suitably qualified contractor for the provision of regular compliance servicing and related maintenance of Fire, Water, Electrical, Gas, Air Conditioning and minor building works, to mainly non-housing properties situated within the geographical areas of the client districts. Premises include Community Centres, Sports Pavilions, Chapels, Offices, Depots, Workshops, Communal Housing areas and the like, which will be serviced by a dedicated multi-skilled workforce.

MAIN_SITE.P: The new framework will be open to all local authorities within Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire, Essex and Buckinghamshire.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Repair and maintenance services of building installations. Stevenage Borough Council is leading on the “ComplyFirst” framework contract seeking a single suitably qualified contractor for the provision of regular compliance servicing and related maintenance of Fire, Water, Electrical, Gas, Air Conditioning and minor building works, to mainly non-housing properties situated within the geographical areas of the client districts. Premises include Community Centres, Sports Pavilions, Chapels, Offices, Depots, Workshops, Communal Housing areas and the like, which will be serviced by a dedicated multi-skilled workforce.

INFO_ADD.P: The 30 000 000 GBP framework value is an estimated figure. The first call-offs within the Hertfordshire areas are estimated at approximately 5 000 000 GBP — 7 000 000 GBP (based on a total estimate annual value of 1 000 000 GBP and assuming terms of 5 to 7 years). The Framework will be open to all local authorities within Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire, Essex and Buckinghamshire.

SUITABILITY.P: Selection criteria as stated in the procurement documents.

PLACE.P: Daneshill House Danestrete Stevenage Herts SG1 1HN.

INFO_ADD.P: Stevenage Borough Council reserves the right to cancel the procurement and not to proceed with the Framework at any stage of the procurement process. Stevenage Borough Council also reserves the right not to award the Framework. Neither Stevenage Borough Council nor any person on whose behalf of whom this procurement is undertaken is to be liable for any costs incurred by those expressing an interest or tendering for these contracts. Tenderers should note that the provisions of the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 may apply. Contracting Authorities who may access this framework are defined as both: Initial Contracting Authorities who shall be entitled to become a party to and call-off of the Framework Agreement, comprising of Stevenage Borough Council (also known as the Lead Contracting Authority), North Hertfordshire District Council, East Hertfordshire District Council, and Broxbourne Borough Council, and Additional Contracting Authorities, (which are not Initial Contracting Authorities) who may request to become a party to and call-off of the Framework Agreement, defined as “any Local Authority or Public Body which operates in the areas of Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire, Essex and Buckinghamshire counties of England”. Full Call-off arrangements and processes are detailed within the Framework Agreement documentation. There is no obligation for any Contracting Authority, whether Initial or Additional, to award any work under this Framework Agreement to the Contractor during the Framework Term and this is a non-exclusive agreement. Contracting Authorities may order services of the same type as any of the Services from other contractors and in addition, a Contracting Authority generally has the right to carry out the Services itself. The appointment of the Contractor under this Framework Agreement is not and shall not be taken as any commitment by a Contracting Authority to issue any Service Contract to the Contractor, therefore offers no assurances, representations, warranties or guarantees in relation to the number of call-offs (Service Contracts), or the volume, value or quantity of any work that will be placed with the Contractor under the Framework Agreement.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Stevenage Borough Council will observe a standstill period following the award of the Contract and conduct itself in respect of any appeals in accordance with the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (as amended).
